name: Canvas Preparation
bob_ross_intro: Welcome! Today we're going to paint a beautiful scene together. Let's start by preparing our canvas with a thin layer of liquid white.
tips: Make sure your liquid white is thin and even
Have all your brushes clean and ready
Remember - we don't make mistakes, just happy accidents!

name: Begin Trees
bob_ross_intro: Now let's bring in our trees. This is going to be so much fun.
tips: Don't overwork this area - it's supporting, not starring
Keep your strokes confident and decisive
This is your world - you can do anything.

name: Trees - Dark Values
instruction: Let's start blocking in the trees - dark values. Load your 1-inch brush with a thin, dark mix. We're just establishing our values here - don't worry about details yet.
tips: Keep your paint thin at this stage
Don't be afraid of the dark - it creates depth
Let's give this little friend some company.

name: Trees - Shadow Mid-tones
instruction: Time to build up our trees - shadow mid-tones. With your 1-inch brush, use build form. Work the paint into the canvas, blending with what's already there.
tips: Let each layer dry slightly before the next
Build up gradually - you can always add more
Let's give this little friend some company.

name: Trees - Light Mid-tones
instruction: Time to build up our trees - light mid-tones. With your filbert, use blend values. Work the paint into the canvas, blending with what's already there.
tips: Let each layer dry slightly before the next
Build up gradually - you can always add more
Let's get a little crazy here.

name: Trees - Light Values
instruction: Let's soften and blend our trees. Take your fan brush and use gentle soft transitions. We're creating smooth transitions between our values.
tips: There are no mistakes, only happy accidents.

name: Begin Dark Trees
bob_ross_intro: Now let's bring in our dark trees. This is going to be so much fun.
tips: Don't overwork this area - it's supporting, not starring
Keep your strokes confident and decisive
Let's get a little crazy here.

name: Dark Trees - Shadow Core
instruction: Let's start blocking in the dark trees - shadow core. Load your 1-inch brush with a thin, dark mix. We're just establishing our values here - don't worry about details yet.
tips: Keep your paint thin at this stage
Don't be afraid of the dark - it creates depth
We don't make mistakes, we have happy accidents.

name: Dark Trees - Shadow Variation
instruction: Time to build up our dark trees - shadow variation. With your filbert, use subtle changes. Work the paint into the canvas, blending with what's already there.
tips: Let each layer dry slightly before the next
Build up gradually - you can always add more
Let's give this little friend some company.

name: Dark Trees - Shadow Mid
instruction: Let's soften and blend our dark trees. Take your fan brush and use gentle soft transitions. We're creating smooth transitions between our values.
tips: Just let it happen naturally.

name: Dark Trees - Shadow Edge
instruction: Let's soften and blend our dark trees. Take your fan brush and use gentle blend to light. We're creating smooth transitions between our values.
tips: There are no mistakes, only happy accidents.

name: Begin Person
bob_ross_intro: Here comes our little friend - the person. This is the star of our painting.
tips: This person is our focal point - take your time here
Build up the form with careful value transitions
Pay attention to the edges - some soft, some defined
Let's give this little friend some company.

name: Person - Shadow Core
instruction: Let's start blocking in the person - shadow core. Load your 1-inch brush with a thin, dark mix. We're just establishing our values here - don't worry about details yet.
tips: Keep your paint thin at this stage
Don't be afraid of the dark - it creates depth
That's a nice touch right there.

name: Person - Shadow Variation
instruction: Time to build up our person - shadow variation. With your filbert, use subtle changes. Work the paint into the canvas, blending with what's already there.
tips: Let each layer dry slightly before the next
Build up gradually - you can always add more
Take your time - there's no pressure.

name: Person - Shadow Mid
instruction: Let's soften and blend our person. Take your fan brush and use gentle soft transitions. We're creating smooth transitions between our values.
tips: This is your world - you can do anything.

name: Person - Shadow Edge
instruction: Let's soften and blend our person. Take your fan brush and use gentle blend to light. We're creating smooth transitions between our values.
tips: Let's get a little crazy here.

name: Final Touches & Sign
bob_ross_outro: There we go! Our painting is complete. Step back and admire your work. Remember, this is YOUR world - you created something beautiful today.
tips: Step back and view from a distance
Make any final value adjustments
Add your signature - you've earned it!
Most importantly - be proud of what you've created!
